headline: BlackRock's Brownback: See M&A Wave in 2026
summary: Russ Brownback, BlackRock's Deputy CIO and Head of Global Macro Positioning, says 2% productivity growth allows the economy to expand without adding hours worked, and that generative AI is poised to push productivity even higher. He speaks with Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on "The Close."

headline: Most Influential: Cathie Wood
summary: Throughout crypto’s ups and downs, Ark Invest CEO Cathie Wood has remained unflaggingly bullish on the industry’s future.

headline: BlackRock Launches First-of-its-Kind ETF Offering Access to the Full US Bond Market
summary: NEW YORK, December 11, 2025--Today, BlackRock announced the launch of the iShares Total USD Fixed Income Market ETF (NYSE: BTOT), the industry’s first index ETF that seeks to provide investors with comprehensive access to the full taxable US bond market in a single, efficient solution.1

headline: Bitcoin Dips Below $90,000 After Fed Cut Widens Stocks Split
summary: The original cryptocurrency fell as much as 3.2% to briefly dip below $90,000 on Thursday, down from an intra-day high of $94,490 the day before, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.  Bitcoin later recovered some of that ground to trade down around 2.3% at $90,260 by early morning in New York, while Ether fell around 4.3%.  Asian equities tracked gains on Wall Street on Thursday morning after Fed Chair Jerome Powell pushed through a quarter percentage point rate cut, but the move did little to lift the mood among crypto traders.

headline: BlackRock Sells 7% Stake in Naturgy for Nearly $2 Billion
summary: BlackRock has sold a 7.1% stake in Naturgy for about 1.7 billion euros through an accelerated bookbuild.

headline: Naturgy Shares Drop After BlackRock Offloads Part of Stake
summary: The sale accounts for about 7.1% of Naturgy’s share capital. BlackRock’s GIP will retain an 11.42% stake in the Spanish energy company.

raw.headline: Naturgy Shares Drop After BlackRock Offloads Part of Stake

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To BHP Group (ASX:BHP) Selling 49% Of Its Pilbara Power Network
summary: Earlier this month, BHP Group agreed a US$2 billion deal for Global Infrastructure Partners, part of BlackRock, to acquire a 49% stake in the inland power network supporting its Western Australia Iron Ore operations, while BHP retains a 51% controlling interest and full operational and strategic control. The transaction effectively converts a minority share of BHP’s Pilbara power infrastructure into cash that can be recycled into higher-priority growth areas such as copper and potash, while...
